_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



The Buckeye Terminals LLC - Buckeye Tampa Butane Rail is an on-shore, light products storage and railcar facility used in the storage and distribution of product to end-users and downstream terminals in the vicinity of Tampa, Florida. The facility currently handles and stores butane. Butane can be received by railcar or truck transport, stored in two 90,000 gallon horizontal storage vessels, and distributed through truck transport or pipeline.  The Risk Management Plan covers the butane system.



The Buckeye Terminals LLC - Buckeye Tampa Butane Rail butane system was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact Tampa Fire Rescue and the City of Tampa Office of Emergency Management, as appropriate, through the 911 Service. The primary hospital response is provided through Tampa General  (also the nearest Level 1 Trauma Center).  The Facility currently maintains a trained incipient stage fire response and first responder-operations level hazardous materials response team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency.



Buckeye Terminals LLC - Buckeye Tampa Butane Rail complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3).  Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor -Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



The Worst Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were evaluated and communicated to Tampa Fire Rescue.  Additionally, the local Emergency Response Action Plan was updated to reflect the addition of

butane.



This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the Butane System resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving Buckeye Tampa Butane Rail, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact Tampa Fire Rescue and request their assistance.  The Facility's Emergency Response Action Plan is coordinated with Tampa Fire Rescue and the City of Tampa Office of Emergency Management.  The fire department is aware of the Facility's Butane System, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release.  The Terminal is fully secured with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site security plan.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety.  Also, Buckeye is implementing a corporate-wide policy to include the local first responders in regular exercises and is developing "global" operating procedures.
